en: A 14 -year-old boy is brought to the emergency department by his parents because of a 1 -month history of intermittent right knee pain that has worsened during the past day. He rates his current pain as a 6 on a 10 -point scale and says that it worsens when he walks and lessens when he sits. During the past 2 weeks, he has been walking 1 mile daily in preparation for participation in the school marching band. He has not taken any medications for his pain. He sustained a right tibia and fibula fracture at the age of 8 years after a skateboarding accident, which was treated with internal fixation and casting. He has asthma treated with inhaled budesonide daily and inhaled albuterol a s needed. His mother has type 2 diabetes mellitus, and his maternal grandmother has osteoporosis. The patient is 170 cm (5 ft 7 in; 77th percentile) tall and weighs 88 kg (195 lb; >95th percentile); BMI is 31 kg/m2 (98th percentile). Temperature is 37.0°C (98.6°F), pulse is 95/min, and blood pressure is 130/80 mm Hg. Physical examination shows hyperpigmented, thickened skin at the nape of the neck. There is tenderness to palpation of the anterior aspect of the right  hip and limited range of motion on abduct ion, internal rotation, and flexion of the right hip. The left hip and knees are nontender; range of motion is full in all directions. The remainder of the examination discloses no abnormalities. Which of the following factors in this patient’s history mos t increased his risk for developing this condition?
es: A 14-year-old boy is brought to the emergency department by his parents because of a 1-month history of intermittent right knee pain that has worsened over the past day. He rates his current pain as a 6 on a 10-point scale and says it is worse when he walks and less when he sits. For the past 2 weeks, he has been walking 1 mile daily to prepare to participate in the school marching band. He has not taken any pain medication. He sustained a fracture of the tibia and fibula at the age of 8 following a skateboarding accident, which was treated with internal fixation and casting. He has asthma, treated with daily inhaled budesonide and inhaled albuterol when needed. His mother has type 2 diabetes mellitus, and his maternal grandmother has osteoporosis. The patient is 170 cm tall (77th percentile) and weighs 88 kg (95th percentile); her BMI is 31 kg/m2 (98th percentile). The temperature is 37.0°C, the pulse is 95/min, and the blood pressure is 130/80 mm Hg. Physical examination shows hyperpigmented and thickened skin on the nape of the neck. There is tenderness over the anterior aspect of the right hip and limited range of motion in abduction, internal rotation, and flexion of the right hip. The left hip and knees are not tender; range of motion is full in all directions. The remainder of the examination is unremarkable. Which of the following factors in this patient's history may increase his or her risk for developing this disease?
ar: A 14-year-old boy was brought to the emergency department by his parents because of intermittent right knee pain for 1 month that had worsened over the past day. He fractured his right tibia and fibula at age 8 years following a skateboarding accident and was treated with internal fixation and a cast. He has asthma and is treated with daily inhaled budesonide and albuterol inhalation as needed. His mother has type 2 diabetes, and his maternal grandmother has osteoporosis. The patient is 170 cm (5 ft 7 in; 77th percentile) tall, weighs 88 kg (195 lb; 95th percentile); his body mass index is 31 kg/m2 (98th percentile). en: A 50 -year-old man comes to the office because of a 2 -month history of increasing daytime somnolence. His temperature is 37°C  (98.6°F), pulse is 100/min, respirations are 12/min, and blood pressure is 135/80  mm Hg. Physical examination shows a gray -blue tinge to the lips, earlobes, and nail beds. Cardiac examination s hows no other abnormalities. Arterial blood gas analysis on room air shows a pH of 7.31, P CO2 of 70  mm Hg, and P O2 of 50 mm Hg. en: A 32 -year-old man comes to the office because of a 1 -day history of cough productive of small amounts of blood and a 2-day history of shortness of breath and swelling of his ankles. He also has a 2 -week history of progressive fatigue and episodes of dark u rine. He has no history of major medical illness and takes no medications. His temperature is 37°C (98.6°F), pulse is 90/min, respirations are 18/min, and blood pressure is 175/110 mm Hg. Pulse oximetry on room air shows an oxygen saturation of 91%. Diffus e inspiratory crackles are heard over all lung bases. There is 2+ pitting edema of both ankles. Results of laboratory studies are shown: Hemoglobin  8.9 g/dL   Hematocrit  27%  Serum   Urea nitrogen  55 mg/dL    Creatinine  2.9 mg/dL   Urine RBC  20–40/hpf   Urinalysis also shows some dysmorphic RBCs and rare RBC casts. Examination of a kidney biopsy specimen shows  crescentic glomerulonephritis and linear deposition of IgG along the glomerular capillaries. This patient most likely has  antibodies directed again st which of the following antigens?
es: A 32-year-old man presents with a 1-day history of cough producing small amounts of blood and a 2-day history of shortness of breath and swelling of his ankles. He also has a 2-week history of progressive fatigue and episodes of dark urine. He has no history of serious illness and is on no medications. His temperature is 37°C, pulse 90/min, respirations 18/min, and blood pressure 175/110 mm Hg. Pulse oximetry on room air shows an oxygen saturation of 91%. Diffuse and inspiratory crackles are heard at all lung bases. There is 2+ pitting edema in both ankles. Laboratory results are shown: Hemoglobin 8.9 g/dL Hematocrit 27% Serum urea nitrogen 55 mg/dL Creatinine 2.9 mg/dL Urine RBCs 20–40/hpf Urinalysis also shows a few dysmorphic RBCs and rare RBC casts. Examination of a renal biopsy specimen shows crescentic glomerulonephritis and linear deposition of IgG along the glomerular capillaries. This patient most likely has antibodies again directed against which of the following antigens?
ar: A 32-year-old man comes to the clinic with a 1-day history of cough producing small amounts of blood and a 2-day history of shortness of breath and ankle swelling. Diffuse inspiratory crackles are heard over all lung bases. There is 2+ pitting edema in both ankles. Laboratory findings show: Hemoglobin 8.9 g/dL Hematocrit 27% Serum urea nitrogen 55 mg/dL Urine red blood cells 2.9 mg/dL Urine red blood cells 20-40/hour Urine, urinalysis shows some unformed red blood cells and rare red blood cell casts. Renal biopsy shows crescentic glomerulonephritis and linear deposition of immunoglobulin along glomerular capillaries. This patient most likely has antibodies directed again to which of the following antigens?

id: A 32-year-old man presents to the office with a 1-day history of coughing up small amounts of blood and a 2-day history of shortness of breath and swelling of his ankles. He also has a 2-week history of progressive fatigue and episodes of dark urine. He has no known medical conditions and is taking no medications. His temperature is 37°C (98.6°F), pulse rate is 90/min, respirations are 18/min, and blood pressure is 175/110 mm Hg. Pulse oximetry on room air shows an oxygen saturation of 91%. Diffuse inspiratory crackles are heard throughout the lung bases. There is 2+ pitting edema in both ankles. Laboratory studies show: Hemoglobin 8.9 g/dL Hematocrit 27% Serum Urea Nitrogen 55 mg/dL Creatinine 2.9 mg/dL Urine ESR 20-40/hpf Urinalysis also shows some dysmorphic ESR and a rare ESR. Examination of a renal biopsy specimen shows crescentic glomerulonephritis and linear deposition of IgG along the glomerular capillaries. This patient most likely has antibodies directed again to which of the following antigens?
ko: A 32-year-old man presents to the clinic with a 1-day history of coughing up blood and 2 days of shortness of breath and ankle swelling. He also has a 2-week history of progressive fatigue and dark urine. He has no major medical history and is not taking any medications. His temperature is 37°C (98.6°F), his pulse is 90/min, his respirations are 18/min, and his blood pressure is 175/110 mmHg. His pulse oximetry on room air shows an oxygen saturation of 91%. There are diffuse and inspiratory crackles at the bases of all lungs. There are two or more pitting edemas on both ankles. Laboratory test results are in: Hemoglobin 8.9 g/dL Hematocrit 27% Serum urea nitrogen 55 mg/dL Creatinine 2.9 mg/dL Urine RBCs 20-40/hpf Urinalysis also shows some dysplastic RBCs and, rarely, RBC casts. Examination of a renal biopsy specimen shows crescentic glomerulonephritis and linear IgG deposits along the glomerular capillaries. This patient most likely has antibodies to which of the following antigens?
ja: A 32-year-old man presented with a cough that produced a small amount of blood 1 day later and shortness of breath and swelling in his ankles 2 days later. He also had episodes of progressive fatigue and dark urine over the past 2 weeks. He had no major medical history and was not taking any medications. His temperature was 37°C, his pulse was 90 beats per minute, his respirations were 18 breaths per minute, and his blood pressure was 175/110 mm Hg. His oxygen saturation was 91% on room pulse oximetry. Diffuse inspiratory crackles were heard at all lung bases. He had 2+ edema in both ankles. Laboratory findings showed hemoglobin 8.9 g/dL, hematocrit 27%, serum urea nitrogen 55 mg/dL, creatinine 2.9 mg/dL, and urinary red blood cells 20-40/hpf. Urinalysis revealed several dysmorphic red blood cells and rare red blood cell casts. Examination of a renal biopsy specimen reveals crescentic glomerulonephritis and linear deposits of IgG along the glomerular capillaries. This patient is likely to have retargeted antibodies to which of the following antigens?
lv: A 32-year-old man comes to the office with a 1-day history of coughing up a small amount of blood and a 2-day history of shortness of breath and ankle swelling. He also has a 2-week history of an episode of progressive fatigue and dark urine. He has had no serious illnesses and does not take any medication. His temperature is 37°C (98.6°F), pulse 90/min, respirations 18/min, and blood pressure 175/110 mm Hg. Pulse oximetry with room air shows an oxygen saturation of 91%. Diffuse respiratory crackles are heard in all lung bases. Both ankles have 2+ punctate edema. The results of laboratory tests are shown: Hemoglobin 8.9 g/dl Hematocrit 27 % Serum urea nitrogen 55 mg/dl Creatinine 2.9 mg/dl Urine RBC 20-40/hpf Urinalysis also shows some dysmorphic RBC and rare RBC wear. Examination of the renal biopsy specimen shows crescentic glomerulonephritis and linear deposition of IgG along the glomerular capillaries. This patient most likely has antibodies against which of the following antigens again?
nl: A 32-year-old man presents to the office with a 1-day cough with small amounts of blood and 2 days of shortness of breath and ankle swelling. He also has a 2-week history of progressive fatigue and episodes of dark eyes. He has no history of significant medical conditions and is taking no medications. His temperature is 37°C, his pulse is 90/min, his respirations are 18/min, and his blood pressure is 175/110 mm Hg. Pulse oximetry on room air shows an oxygen saturation of 91%. Diffuse inspiratory crackles are heard over all lung floors. There is 2+ pitting edema of both ankles. Laboratory results are shown: Hemoglobin 8.9 g/dL Hematocrit 27% Serum Urea Nitrogen 55 mg/dL Creatinine 2.9 mg/dL Urine RBC 20-40/hpf Urinalysis also shows some dysmorphic RBCs and rare RBC casts. Examination of a renal biopsy specimen shows crescent-shaped glomerulonephritis and linear deposition of IgG along the glomerular capillaries. This patient most likely has antibodies directed against which of the following antigens?
it: A 32-year-old man presents to the office with a 1-day history of cough producing small amounts of blood and a 2-day history of shortness of breath and ankle swelling. He also has a 2-week history of progressive fatigue and episodes of darkness. He has no history of serious illness and is taking no medications. Temperature is 37°C, pulse is 90/min, respirations are 18/min, and blood pressure is 175/110 mm Hg. Pulse oximetry with room air shows oxygen saturation of 91%. Diffuse inspiratory and audible crackles are heard over all lung bases. Both ankles have edema of the pitting grade 2+. Laboratory findings are reported: Hemoglobin 8.9 g/dL Hematocrit 27% Serum urea nitrogen 55 mg/dL Creatinine 2.9 mg/dL Urine RBC 20-40/hpf Urinalysis also shows some dysmorphic RBCs and rare RBC casts. Examination of a renal biopsy specimen shows crescentic glomerulonephritis and linear IgG deposition along the glomerular capillaries. This patient most likely has antibodies directed again to which of the following antigens?
